Charles Schwab Corporation (CSC) is a savings and loan holding company . At December 31, 2024, Schwab had $10.10 trillion in client assets, 36.5 million active brokerage accounts, 5.4 million workplace plan participant accounts, and 2.0 million banking accounts . Schwab provides financial services to individuals and institutional clients through two segments – Investor Services and Advisor Services .
 Advisor Services segment provides custodial, trading, banking and trust, and support services to independent registered investment advisors (RIAs), independent retirement advisors, and recordkeepers . Schwab was founded on the belief that all Americans deserve access to a better investing experience . Management has adopted a strategy described as “Through Clients’ Eyes.”
 The Charles Schwab Corporation is one of the largest investment services firms in the U.S. Schwab's $10.10 trillion in client assets leaves substantial opportunity for growth . The firm's key competitive advantages are:Scale and size of the business, operating efficiency and sharing of infrastructure across different businesses creates a cost advantage .
 Schwab Trading Powered by Ameritrade™ is an enhanced trading experience made possible by the combination of the thinkorswim trading platform with Schwab’s trading capabilities on Schwab.com and Schwab Mobile.com . Schwab Holding LLC (Ameritrade Holding LLC), effective October 6, 2020, is now complete .
 In May 2024, we converted approximately $1.9 trillion in client assets across more than 17 million client accounts, including 7,000 RIAs, from Ameritrade to Schwab . As of December 31, 2024, the Company completed the conversion of the final client transition group to the Schwab platform . In accordance with the 2023 IDA agreement, cash held in eligible brokerage client accounts is no longer held .
 Schwab provides recordkeeping and support services to the TD Depository Institutions with respect to the deposit accounts for which Schwab receives an aggregate monthly fee . Under the 2023 IDA agreement, the service fee on client cash deposits held at the TD depository institutions remains at 15 basis points . Schwab offers a broad range of products and services through intuitive end-to-end solutions, including robust digital capabilities .
 Charles Schwab initially founded the Company 50 years ago to provide individual investors with access to the financial markets at a highly competitive cost . Schwab’s major sources of revenues are generated by both of the reportable segments, based on their respective levels of client assets and activity . The Investor Services segment includes the following business units: Retail Investor, Workplace Financial Services, Retirement Plan Services, Stock Plan Services and Designated Brokerage Services .
 At the core of our offer is our broad set of relationship models that help personalize the investing journey for our clients . We offer award-winning and 24/7 service to all our clients, regardless of asset levels, via a multi-channel service delivery model, which includes online, mobile, telephone, and branch support . We also have a range of roles to support clients with financial planning, managed investing, trading, and equity compensation .
 Charles Schwab offers clients access to professional investment management in a diversified account that is invested exclusively in either  funds or ETFs . Schwab Managed Portfolios Premium offers clients an advisory service which combines our robo-robo-based investment advisory service with a dedicated Wealth Advisor, supported by a team of wealth management professionals who provide individualized service, financial planning, a customized investment strategy developed in collaboration with the client, and ongoing guidance and execution .
 Schwab Intelligent Income is a low-cost solution designed to offer a simple, modern way to generate income from existing investment portfolios . Schwab offers integrated web-, mobile-, and software-based trading platforms, real-time market data, access to an extensive set of tradeable products, premium research, and multi-channel access, as well as sophisticated account and trade management features, risk management tools, and dedicated service support – all at highly competitive pricing .
 Schwab Coaching delivers online and in-person workshops as well as live and on-demand webcasts . Schwab Equity Ratings provides clients with ratings on approximately 3,000 stocks, assigning each equity a single grade: A, B, C, D, or F. Schwab Stock Slices enables investors to purchase a single stock slice, or up to 30 different stock slices at once, from the Standard & Poor’s. 500 Index (S&P 500 Index) Schwab Investing Themes™ is a thematic investing offer .
 Workplace Financial Services includes Retirement Plan Services, Retirement Business Services, Stock Plan Services and Designated Brokerage Services . Retirement plan design features, which increase plan efficiency and achieve plan sponsor goals, are also offered, including automatic enrollment, automatic fund mapping at conversion, and automatic contribution increases . The Investor Services segment includes retirement plan assets held at Charles Schwab Trust Bank (Trust Bank)
 Stock Plan Services offers equity compensation stock plan administrators full-service recordkeeping for stock plans, stock options, restricted stock, performance shares, stock appreciation rights, and a full range of participant support services . Designated Brokerage Services supports employers’ needs for employee account surveillance (trading and reporting) through a consultative and best practices approach . Single-custodian solutions combine technology with experienced service team members to help compliance professionals manage risk .
 Schwab has become one of the largest providers of custodial, trading, banking, and support services to RIAs and their clients . The Advisor Services website is the core platform for RIAs to conduct daily business activities online with Schwab . Schwab may use proprietary software that provides them with up-to-date client account information .
 The Advisor Services website also provides interactive tools, educational content, and thought leadership for advisors turning independent . We offer a variety of services to help RIAs grow and manage their practices, including business, technology, and operations consulting . Schwab provides extensive educational materials, programs, and events to RIAs seeking to expand their knowledge of industry issues and trends .
 Schwab’s largest sources of net revenues are net interest revenue, asset management and administration fees, trading revenue, and bank deposit account fees . Schwab earns revenue associated with the underlying client assets, predominantly through net interest . The thinkpipes®®™™™ trading platform offers real-time charting and efficient trading and allocation, and iRebal™™ provides customizable portfolio rebalancing .
 Schwab ’s interest-earning assets are primarily comprised of high-quality fixed income securities, margin loans, and bank loans . Schwab is subject to extensive regulation under both federal and state laws by governmental agencies, supervisory authorities, and self-regulatory organizations (SROs) Schwab has elected to be treated as a Financial Holding Company (FHC)
 The Federal Reserve has the authority to limit an FHC’s ability to conduct otherwise permissible FHC Activities . An FHC may also engage in activities that are financial in nature or incidental to a financial activity (FHC Activities) The FHC and its subsidiaries may not commence any new FHC Activity, either de novo or through acquisition, without prior Federal Reserve approval .
 CSC’s three depository institution subsidiaries are CSB, CSPB, and Trust Bank . Trust Bank is currently regulated, supervised, and examined by the Federal Reserve, the Texas Department of Savings and Mortgage Lending (TDSML), the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB), and the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation .
 Regulators have established four risk-based categories for large U.S. banking organizations with $100 billion or more in total consolidated assets . CSC is generally subject to the requirements under Category III based on its total . assets of between $250 billion and less than $700 billion . As of December 31, 2024, CSC had total . consolidated assets of approximately $480 billion and cross-jurisdictional activity of approximately . $27 billion .
 CSC is subject to the stress capital buffer requirement, which applies to risk-based capital ratios . Category III organizations are permitted to opt out of including most components of accumulated other comprehensive income (AOCI) in their regulatory capital calculations . Category II organizations are not permitted to include AOCI in their capital calculations and have additional requirements .
 Schwab began incorporating market risk capital for the period ending December 31, 2022, and while CSC is required to make adjustments to its risk-weighted assets related to de minimis positions, those adjustments have not significantly impacted our risk-based capital ratios . Schwab is subject to the rule and public disclosure requirement on a consolidated basis .
 Schwab is required to maintain HQLA to cover 100% of the total stressed net cash outflows on a daily basis . The final Net Stable Funding Ratio (NSFR) rule was jointly adopted by the Federal Reserve, the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency, and the FDIC to strengthen the resilience of large bank and savings and loan holding companies . CSC and CSB conducted company-run stress tests in 2024 .
 Savings and loan holding companies with total consolidated assets of $100 billion or more are subject to an annual Comprehensive Capital Analysis and Review (CCAR) process . These requirements also impose a stress capital buffer requirement, floored at 2.5 percent of risk-weighted assets . CSC received the results of the Federal Reserve’s 2024 CCAR in June 2024 .
 CSC is required to comply with these risk management and risk committee requirements, the liquidity risk-management, stress testing, and buffer requirements, as well as the single counterparty credit limits . The Federal Reserve, together with the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency and the FDIC, issued a proposed rulemaking on long-term debt requirements for certain large banking organizations in August 2023 .
 In June 2024, the FDIC adopted a new final rule with additional requirements for IDI resolution plans . Large banks with total assets of at least $100 billion are required to submit comprehensive resolution plans that meet enhanced standards . The FDIC’s Deposit Insurance Fund provides insurance coverage for certain deposits, generally up to $250,000 per depositor per account ownership type .
 In November 2023, the FDIC approved a special assessment to recover losses incurred by the DIF in 2023 to protect uninsured depositors due to the March 2023 closures of two banks . The special assessment will remain in effect until DIF reserve ratio meets FDIC’s long-term goal of 2%.
 The Community Reinvestment Act requires the primary federal bank regulatory agency for each of Schwab’s depository institution subsidiaries to assess the record in meeting the credit needs of the communities served by the bank . The failure of an institution to receive at least a “satisfactory” rating could inhibit the institution or its holding company from undertaking certain activities, including acquisitions or opening branch offices .
 Charles Schwab Futures and Forex LLC (CSFF) is registered as an FCM and FDM with the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) CS&Co is a member of FINRA and the Municipal Securities Rulemaking Board (MSRB) CSFF is the primary regulator for CSFF’s futures, commodities, and forex trading activities .
 CS&Co is subject to Rule 15c3-1 under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (the Uniform Net Capital Rule) and related SRO requirements . The CFTC and NFA also impose net capital requirements . CSC itself is not a registered broker-dealer and it is not subject to the rule .
 Schwab offers a compensation package that rewards both employee and company performance . As of December 31, 2024, Schwab had full-time, part-time and temporary employees, and persons employed on a contract basis, that represented the equivalent of approximately 32,100 full time employees . Schwab is subject to rules and regulations issued by certain foreign authorities, including the Financial Conduct Authority in the United Kingdom, the Securities and Futures Commission in Hong Kong, the Monetary Authority of Singapore in Singapore .
 Schwab files annual, quarterly, and current reports, proxy statements, and other information with the SEC . Schwab offers a hybrid work and flexibility approach to work arrangements that is designed to balance the importance our employees place on workplace flexibility with the benefits of in-person interactions to train and learn from one another, build human connections, and maintain Schwab’s culture .
 The Charles Schwab Corporation posts free of charge filings on its website or by request via email (investor.relations@schwab.com), or mail (Charles Schwab Investor Relations at 3000 Schwab Way, Westlake, TX 76262) The company also posts the Dodd-Frank stress test results, regulatory capital disclosures based on Basel III, our average LCR, and our average NSFR .
